children.value: A Page header is used to build the outer structure of a page, including the page title and associated actions.

properties.headline: This component is under development
properties.tagline: There will likely be breaking changes to the API. Proceed with caution.

children.value: Responsive subnavigation variants (collapsing tabs into menu when space constrained)
Always provide a title for the page
Optionally provide a description to provide more context about the page content
Always provide a link back when a page has a parent page
Offer common actions that apply to the whole page and are important enough to appear before the page content

Use title case for the Page title, and describe the page in as few words as possible. Typically this will be the primary identifier or a pluralized name when the page is a list. Avoid truncating the page title.
Use clear and predictable labels for page actions, favoring the {verb}+{noun} naming format where there may be ambiguity about the target of the action.
Consider wrapping page header actions in a
to manage how they stack at smaller breakpoints.
Avoid using interactive components for displaying status information
Used for summary or detail pages with no further action to take.
Used when a page belongs to a parent page or collection. The
prop must include a label. Optionally, the breadcrumb may include an
to trigger navigation or support the handling side effects (such as logging page views).
to render a visibly hidden label for providing additional context to improve accessibility.

<EzPageHeader
  title="Order # XYZ-123"
  breadcrumb={{
    label: 'Back to Orders',
    accessibilityLabel: 'Orders list',
    onClick: () => alert('Clicked back'),
  }}
/>

properties.ariaLabel: page header with breadcrumb links permalink

children.value: , Page navigation can also be triggered using links.
The breadcrumb can be used to render a link by proving an
, but in order to support client-side routing implementations, you can instead provide a Link component, such as
to provide the destination url for the link.

<EzPageHeader
  title="Order # XYZ-123"
  breadcrumb={{
    label: 'Back to Orders',
    href: '/components/ez-page-header#page-header-with-breadcrumb-links',
  }}
/>
Used to communicate brief, important and non-interactive status information about the page. The status appears immediately after the page title. The
While call to actions are typically found at the bottom of cards within the page content, the space in the top-right of a page header is ideal for common actions associated for the page as a whole.
Consider wrapping actions in an EzLayout to manage how they stack at smaller breakpoints.

<EzPageHeader
  title="Order # XYZ-123"
  actions={
    <EzLayout
      layout={{
        base: 'stack',
        medium: 'basic',
      }}
    >
      <EzButton use="secondary" destructive>
        Reject Order
      </EzButton>
      <EzButton use="secondary">Request Third Party Delivery</EzButton>
      <EzButton use="primary">Accept Order</EzButton>
    </EzLayout>
  }
/>
Use page header with subnavigation to offer multiple views related to the page. To enable subnavigation, use the
prop should be provided an object that describes paths to related pages and the current selection.
object can have the following properties:
(required): an array that represents each of the related views available for navigation.
array that represents the currently displayed view.
: An event handler for notifying when the user has selected a link to view.
for the related page and can optionally provide an
for providing additional context to improve accessibility. Optionally, tabs may include an
handler to support the handling of actions that occur when tabs are clicked (such as logging page views);
The following example demonstrates how subnavigation can use
events to switch which view to display. Page navigation can also be triggered using links as shown in the
Page header with subnavigation links example

properties.ariaLabel: page header with subnavigation links permalink

Use this pattern to present filters, related links or tertiary actions relating to the page-level content. Use the subheader pattern in favor of Page header actions in order to utilize the additional space provided by the subheader.
Subheader content is reserved for actions associated for the page as a whole. For actions that apply only to a single card, it’s best to use card actions instead.
prop to provide filters, related links or actions to display within the subheader.
components should be used to layout subheader content and manage how content should stack at smaller breakpoints.

properties.ariaLabel: page header with subheader and tabs permalink

children.value: Page header with subheader and tabs
Use this pattern to present filters, related links or tertiary actions relating to the tab-level content.
For filters or actions that apply only to a single card, it’s best to use card actions instead.
prop to provide filters, related links or actions to display within the subheader.
components should be used to layout subheader content and manage how content should stack at smaller breakpoints.
to provide appropriate labels to describe the filter.

properties.ariaLabel: page with all header elements permalink

children.value: Use for detail pages, which should have return links and may also often have related pages and page actions.
The Page Header component internally uses
and may require a polyfill to provide
depending on the specific requirements for your application. We recommend using
in your application to apply necessary polyfills only when they are needed for the requesting browser.
refactor: Updated EzLayout to use flexbox gap for layout (where available), or
refactor: Added feature detection as part of
to facilitate css-based fallbacks for browser features.
fix: card size should not be inherited by nested cards
fix: Quiet cards should respect size prop if provided.
workflow: Updated visual regression environment for Chrome to use v91 (upgraded from v79).
workflow: added changesets to automate semver tracking and releases.
fix: search input overflows bounds of the EzLayout container. Closes

Added playroom links to examples in docs.
Added a toggle to examples for toggling between example code and preview.

fix: Server rendering of checkboxes and labels will no longer render
fix: apply range media queries to
(instead of max-width queries), to avoid SSR order-of-insertion issues.
